title: Coole, Marne
text:
Coole () is a <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> in the <a href="Marne%20%28department%29">Marne</a> <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a> in north-eastern <a href="France">France</a>.
Geography.
Coole is situated at the intersection of the N4 highway and the D4 road. The N4 connects <a href="S%C3%A9zanne">Sézanne</a> to the east with <a href="Vitry-le-Fran%C3%A7ois">Vitry-le-François</a> to the west. The D4 goes south to <a href="Sompuis">Sompuis</a> and north to <a href="Coolus">Coolus</a>, near <a href="Ch%C3%A2lons-en-Champagne">Châlons-en-Champagne</a>. The town is near the source of the Coole River which flows northward before emptying into the <a href="Marne%20%28river%29">Marne River</a> near Coolus.
On the 1757 map drawn by <a href="C%C3%A9sar-Fran%C3%A7ois%20Cassini%20de%20Thury">César-François Cassini de Thury</a>, the original name of the river was Côle and the name of the town was Cosle.
